title: Interactive Explanations by Conflict Resolution via Argumentative Exchanges. (arXiv:2303.15022v2 [cs.AI] UPDATED)
abstract: As the field of explainable AI (XAI) is maturing, calls for interactive explanations for (the outputs of) AI models are growing, but the state-of-the-art predominantly focuses on static explanations. In this paper, we focus instead on interactive explanations framed as conflict resolution between agents (i.e. AI models and/or humans) by leveraging on computational argumentation. Specifically, we define Argumentative eXchanges (AXs) for dynamically sharing, in multi-agent systems, information harboured in individual agents' quantitative bipolar argumentation frameworks towards resolving conflicts amongst the agents. We then deploy AXs in the XAI setting in which a machine and a human interact about the machine's predictions. We identify and assess several theoretical properties characterising AXs that are suitable for XAI. Finally, we instantiate AXs for XAI by defining various agent behaviours, e.g. capturing counterfactual patterns of reasoning in machines and highlighting the effects

translated_title: 通过争论交换实现交互式解释
translated_abstract: 随着可解释性人工智能（XAI）领域的成熟，要求为（人工智能模型的）输出提供交互式解释的呼声正在增加，但现有技术主要集中在静态解释上。本文着重介绍了将交互式解释框架化为代理之间的冲突解决，并借助计算论证来实现。具体而言，我们定义了Argumentative eXchanges（AXs），以在多代理系统中动态共享个体代理的双极论证框架中的信息，以解决代理之间的冲突。然后，我们将AXs部署在XAI设置中，其中机器和人类互动讨论机器的预测。我们确定并评估了几个理论属性，这些属性适用于XAI的AXs。最后，我们通过定义各种代理行为（例如，捕获机器中的反事实推理模式并突出其影响）来实例化XAI的AXs。
tldr: 本文介绍了一种利用计算论证实现代理间冲突解决的交互式解释方法，适用于XAI，能够动态共享代理的信息以解决代理之间的冲突。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces an interactive explanation method using computational argumentation to achieve conflict resolution between agents in XAI, which can dynamically share information of individual agents to resolve conflicts.
